segment.source: Creating a Virtual PC Image for MED-V
segment.target: Creating a Virtual PC Image for MED-V

segment.source: Creating a Virtual PC Image for MED-V
segment.target: Creating a Virtual PC Image for MED-V

segment.source: Creating a Virtual PC Image for MED-V
segment.target: Creating a Virtual PC Image for MED-V

segment.source: To create a Virtual PC (VPC) image for MED-V, you must perform the following:
segment.target: To create a Virtual PC (VPC) image for MED-V, you must perform the following:

segment.source: Create a VPC image.
segment.target: Create a VPC image.

segment.source: Install the MED-V workspace .msi package onto the VPC image.
segment.target: Install the MED-V workspace .msi package onto the VPC image.

segment.source: Run the MED-V virtual machine prerequisites tool on the VPC image.
segment.target: Run the MED-V virtual machine prerequisites tool on the VPC image.

segment.source: Manually configure virtual machine prerequisites on the VPC image.
segment.target: Manually configure virtual machine prerequisites on the VPC image.

segment.source: Configure Sysprep for MED-V images (optional).
segment.target: Configure Sysprep for MED-V images (optional).

segment.source: Turn off Microsoft Virtual PC.
segment.target: Turn off Microsoft Virtual PC.

segment.source: Creating a Virtual PC Image by Using Microsoft Virtual PC
segment.target: Creating a Virtual PC Image by Using Microsoft Virtual PC

segment.source: To create a Virtual PC image using Microsoft Virtual PC, refer to the Virtual PC documentation.
segment.target: To create a Virtual PC image using Microsoft Virtual PC, refer to the Virtual PC documentation.

segment.source: For more information, see the following:
segment.target: For more information, see the following:

segment.source: Windows Virtual PC Help
segment.target: Windows Virtual PC Help

segment.source: Create a virtual machine and install a guest operating system
segment.target: Create a virtual machine and install a guest operating system

segment.source: How to Install the MED-V Workspace .msi Package
segment.target: How to Install the MED-V Workspace .msi Package

segment.source: After the Virtual PC image is created, install the MED-V workspace .msi package onto the image.
segment.target: After the Virtual PC image is created, install the MED-V workspace .msi package onto the image.

segment.source: To install the MED-V workspace image
segment.target: To install the MED-V workspace image

segment.source: Start the virtual machine, and copy the MED-V workspace .msi package inside.
segment.target: Start the virtual machine, and copy the MED-V workspace .msi package inside.

segment.source: The MED-V workspace .msi package is called MED-Vworkspacex.msi, where x is the version number.
segment.target: The MED-V workspace .msi package is called MED-Vworkspacex.msi, where x is the version number.

segment.source: For example, MED-Vworkspace1.0.65.msi.
segment.target: For example, MED-Vworkspace1.0.65.msi.

segment.source: Double-click the MED-V workspace .msi package, and follow the installation wizard instructions.
segment.target: Double-click the MED-V workspace .msi package, and follow the installation wizard instructions.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: When a new MED-V version is released, and an existing Virtual PC image is updated, uninstall the existing MED-V workspace .msi package, reboot the computer, and install the new MED-V workspace .msi package.
segment.target: When a new MED-V version is released, and an existing Virtual PC image is updated, uninstall the existing MED-V workspace .msi package, reboot the computer, and install the new MED-V workspace .msi package.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: After the MED-V workspace .msi package is installed, other products that replace GINA cannot be installed.
segment.target: After the MED-V workspace .msi package is installed, other products that replace GINA cannot be installed.

segment.source: How to Run the Virtual Machine Prerequisites Tool
segment.target: How to Run the Virtual Machine Prerequisites Tool

segment.source: The virtual machine (VM) prerequisites tool is a wizard that automates several of the prerequisites.
segment.target: The virtual machine (VM) prerequisites tool is a wizard that automates several of the prerequisites.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Although many parameters are configurable in the wizard, the properties required for the proper functioning of MED-V are not configurable.
segment.target: Although many parameters are configurable in the wizard, the properties required for the proper functioning of MED-V are not configurable.

segment.source: To run the virtual machine prerequisites tool
segment.target: To run the virtual machine prerequisites tool

segment.source: After the MED-V workspace .msi package is installed, on the Windows Start menu, select All Programs MED-V VM Prerequisites Tool.
segment.target: After the MED-V workspace .msi package is installed, on the Windows Start menu, select All Programs MED-V VM Prerequisites Tool.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The user running the virtual machine prerequisites tool must have local administrator rights and must be the only user logged in.
segment.target: The user running the virtual machine prerequisites tool must have local administrator rights and must be the only user logged in.

segment.source: The MED-V VM Prerequisite Wizard Welcome page appears.
segment.target: The MED-V VM Prerequisite Wizard Welcome page appears.

segment.source: Click Next.
segment.target: Click Next.

segment.source: On the Windows Settings page, from the following configurable properties, select the ones to be configured:
segment.target: On the Windows Settings page, from the following configurable properties, select the ones to be configured:

segment.source: Clear users’ personal history information
segment.target: Clear users’ personal history information

segment.source: Clear local profiles temp directory
segment.target: Clear local profiles temp directory

segment.source: Disable sounds on following Windows events: start, logon, logoff
segment.target: Disable sounds on following Windows events: start, logon, logoff

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Do not enable Windows page saver in a group policy.
segment.target: Do not enable Windows page saver in a group policy.

segment.source: Click Next.
segment.target: Click Next.

segment.source: On the Internet Explorer Settings page, from the following configurable properties, select the ones to be configured:
segment.target: On the Internet Explorer Settings page, from the following configurable properties, select the ones to be configured:

segment.source: Don't use auto complete features
segment.target: Don't use auto complete features

segment.source: Disable reuse of windows for launching shortcuts
segment.target: Disable reuse of windows for launching shortcuts

segment.source: Clear browsing history
segment.target: Clear browsing history

segment.source: Enable tabbed browsing in Internet Explorer 7
segment.target: Enable tabbed browsing in Internet Explorer 7

segment.source: Click Next.
segment.target: Click Next.

segment.source: On the Windows Services page, from the following configurable properties, select the ones to be configured:
segment.target: On the Windows Services page, from the following configurable properties, select the ones to be configured:

segment.source: Security center service
segment.target: Security center service

segment.source: Task scheduler service
segment.target: Task scheduler service

segment.source: Automatic updates service
segment.target: Automatic updates service

segment.source: System restore service
segment.target: System restore service

segment.source: Indexing service
segment.target: Indexing service

segment.source: Wireless Zero Configuration
segment.target: Wireless Zero Configuration

segment.source: Fast User Switching Compatibility
segment.target: Fast User Switching Compatibility

segment.source: Click Next.
segment.target: Click Next.

segment.source: On the Windows Auto Logon page, do the following:
segment.target: On the Windows Auto Logon page, do the following:

segment.source: Select the Enable Windows Auto Logon check box.
segment.target: Select the Enable Windows Auto Logon check box.

segment.source: Assign a User name and Password.
segment.target: Assign a User name and Password.

segment.source: Click Apply, and in the confirmation box that appears, click Yes.
segment.target: Click Apply, and in the confirmation box that appears, click Yes.

segment.source: On the Summary page, click Finish to quit the wizard
segment.target: On the Summary page, click Finish to quit the wizard

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Verify that group policies do not overwrite the mandatory settings set in the prerequisites tool.
segment.target: Verify that group policies do not overwrite the mandatory settings set in the prerequisites tool.

segment.source: How to Configure MED-V Virtual Machine Manual Installation Prerequisites
segment.target: How to Configure MED-V Virtual Machine Manual Installation Prerequisites

segment.source: Several of the configurations cannot be configured through the virtual machine prerequisites tool and must be performed manually.
segment.target: Several of the configurations cannot be configured through the virtual machine prerequisites tool and must be performed manually.

segment.source: Virtual Machine Settings
segment.target: Virtual Machine Settings

segment.source: It is recommended to configure the following virtual machine settings in the Microsoft Virtual PC console:
segment.target: It is recommended to configure the following virtual machine settings in the Microsoft Virtual PC console:

segment.source: Disable floppy disk drives.
segment.target: Disable floppy disk drives.

segment.source: Disable undo-disks (Settings undo-disks).
segment.target: Disable undo-disks (Settings undo-disks).

segment.source: Ensure that the image has only one virtual CPU.
segment.target: Ensure that the image has only one virtual CPU.

segment.source: Eliminate interactions between the virtual machine and the user, where they are not related to published applications (such as, messages requiring user input).
segment.target: Eliminate interactions between the virtual machine and the user, where they are not related to published applications (such as, messages requiring user input).

segment.source: Image Settings
segment.target: Image Settings

segment.source: Configure the following manual settings inside the image:
segment.target: Configure the following manual settings inside the image:

segment.source: In the Power Options Properties window, disable hibernation and sleep.
segment.target: In the Power Options Properties window, disable hibernation and sleep.

segment.source: Apply the most recent Windows updates.
segment.target: Apply the most recent Windows updates.

segment.source: In the Windows Startup and Recovery dialog box, in the System Failure section, clear the Automatically restart check box.
segment.target: In the Windows Startup and Recovery dialog box, in the System Failure section, clear the Automatically restart check box.

segment.source: Ensure that the image uses a VLK license key.
segment.target: Ensure that the image uses a VLK license key.

segment.source: Installing VPC Additions
segment.target: Installing VPC Additions

segment.source: On the Action menu, select Install or Update Virtual Machine Additions.
segment.target: On the Action menu, select Install or Update Virtual Machine Additions.

segment.source: Configuring Printing
segment.target: Configuring Printing

segment.source: You can configure printing from the MED-V workspace in either of the following ways:
segment.target: You can configure printing from the MED-V workspace in either of the following ways:

segment.source: Add a printer to the virtual machine.
segment.target: Add a printer to the virtual machine.

segment.source: Allow printing with printers that are configured on the host computer.
segment.target: Allow printing with printers that are configured on the host computer.

segment.source: How to Configure Sysprep for MED-V Images
segment.target: How to Configure Sysprep for MED-V Images

segment.source: In a MED-V workspace, Sysprep can be configured in order to assign unique security ID (SID), particularly when multiple MED-V workspaces are run on a single computer.
segment.target: In a MED-V workspace, Sysprep can be configured in order to assign unique security ID (SID), particularly when multiple MED-V workspaces are run on a single computer.

segment.source: It is not recommended to use Sysprep to join a domain; instead, use the MED-V join domain script action as described in How to Set Up Script Actions.
segment.target: It is not recommended to use Sysprep to join a domain; instead, use the MED-V join domain script action as described in How to Set Up Script Actions.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Sysprep is Microsoft's system preparation utility for the Windows operating system.
segment.target: Sysprep is Microsoft's system preparation utility for the Windows operating system.

segment.source: To configure Sysprep in a MED-V workspace
segment.target: To configure Sysprep in a MED-V workspace

segment.source: Create a directory in the root of the system drive named Sysprep.
segment.target: Create a directory in the root of the system drive named Sysprep.

segment.source: From the Windows installation CD, extract deploy.cab to the root of the system drive, or download the latest Deployment Tools update from the Microsoft Web site.
segment.target: From the Windows installation CD, extract deploy.cab to the root of the system drive, or download the latest Deployment Tools update from the Microsoft Web site.

segment.source: For Windows 2000, see Deployment Tools update for Windows 2000.
segment.target: For Windows 2000, see Deployment Tools update for Windows 2000.

segment.source: For Windows XP, see Deployment Tools update for Windows XP.
segment.target: For Windows XP, see Deployment Tools update for Windows XP.

segment.source: Run Setup Manager (setupmgr.exe).
segment.target: Run Setup Manager (setupmgr.exe).

segment.source: Follow the Setup Manager wizard.
segment.target: Follow the Setup Manager wizard.

segment.source: After Sysprep is configured and the MED-V workspace is created, Sysprep must be executed.
segment.target: After Sysprep is configured and the MED-V workspace is created, Sysprep must be executed.

segment.source: To run Sysprep
segment.target: To run Sysprep

segment.source: From the Sysprep folder located in the root of the system drive, run the System Preparation Tool (Sysprep.exe).
segment.target: From the Sysprep folder located in the root of the system drive, run the System Preparation Tool (Sysprep.exe).

segment.source: In the warning message box that appears, click OK.
segment.target: In the warning message box that appears, click OK.

segment.source: In the Sysprep Properties dialog box, select the Don't reset grace period for activation and Use Mini-Setup check boxes.
segment.target: In the Sysprep Properties dialog box, select the Don't reset grace period for activation and Use Mini-Setup check boxes.

segment.source: Click Reseal.
segment.target: Click Reseal.

segment.source: If you are not satisfied with the information listed in the confirmation message box that appears, click Cancel and change the selections.
segment.target: If you are not satisfied with the information listed in the confirmation message box that appears, click Cancel and change the selections.

segment.source: Click OK to complete the system preparation process.
segment.target: Click OK to complete the system preparation process.

segment.source: Turning Off Microsoft Virtual PC
segment.target: Turning Off Microsoft Virtual PC

segment.source: After all the components are installed and configured, close Microsoft Virtual PC and select Turn Off.
segment.target: After all the components are installed and configured, close Microsoft Virtual PC and select Turn Off.

segment.target: Related topics
